availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
IN THE NAME AND BY THE AUTHORITY OF
The Commonwealth of Kentucky,
KENTUCKY
UNITED WE STAND DIVIDED WE FALL
JAMES F. ROBINSON,
GOVERNOR OF SAID COMMONWEALTH
To all these Presents shall come, Greeting:

Know Ye, that Benj F. Meek Esq having been duly elected appointed "Commissioner of the Institution for the Education of Idiots and Feeble Minded Children" under act of General Assembly Approved Aug 31. 1862 I hereby invest him with full power and authority to execute and discharge the duties of said office according to law: And to have and to hold the same, with all the rights and emoluments thereto legally appertaining, for and during the term prescribed by law.

figure.ab:
SEAL OF KENTUCKY
UNITED WE STAND DIVIDED WE FALL

body.p: In Testimony Whereof, I have caused these letters to be made patent, and the Seal of the Commonwealth to be hereunto affixed. Done at Frankfort, the 16th day of Decr, in the year of our Lord, one thousand eight hundred and 62, and in the 71st year of the Commonwealth.

BY THE GOVERNOR: J F Robinson
D C Wickliffe, Secretary of State.
Commonwealth Office -- WM. E. HUGHES, State Printer.

Inst Feeble Minded Children
Tho. S. Page
Comr
Appd Decr. 27 1862
